name: Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers

reviews.text: I've stayed in the Magnificent Mile part of Chicago several times, but this was my first stay at the Sheraton. I was very impressed by the cleanliness and efficiency of the hotel and the courteousness of the staff. Check-in was very fast and the person at the front desk made sure I got all sorts of upgrades for being a Starwood Preferred Guest that I would have never remembered to ask for. The rooms are not huge, but they are nice and functional. The Internet Access is fast and the showers have good water pressure (I was on the 16th floor). You can't beat the location of the hotel. It is convenient if you are shopping the Magnificent Mile or if you have business in the loop. It is a short walk to Millennium/Grant Park.
reviews.title: Chicago Trip - May 2013
Celebrating Grandson's 12th year!
reviews.text: We've always taken our now-adult children to Chicago to celebrate milestones and always stayed at the Sheraton Towers. We stay on the club level for the breathtaking view and outstanding attention we receive. We took our 12 yr. old Grandson to experience Chicago and he is now set to move there when he is an adult. Special kudos to the club level staff and the women at the Concierge desk. We'll be back with the other Grands!

This was my second stay at this hotel. The decision to return was a no-brainer given the terrific service and accommodations provided the first time. I was not disappointed. The room was well-appointed and the staff were friendly and laser-focused on assisting guests. The location is very convenient. If you have to be anywhere near downtown Chicago, I recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: May, 2013 stay

reviews.text: It was our first time to Chicago, we came for a friend's son's wedding. Most of the people we knew who came to the wedding stayed at a different hotel. I couldn't believe it when I was in their hotel, it cost over $100 more per night and the Sheraton put rings around it. The Sheraton is just beautiful and the location was perfect for our needs. Lunch on the river was perfect, the room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The staff was very helpful, I can't say a bad thing about it. Probably one of the nicest hotels I've every stayed at. I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Karen

reviews.text: The reason why this hotel was first on my list while attending the Sweets Show for the 3rd year is because the rooms are spacious, clean, well stocked, the front desk and room maids were helpful and happy, and the business desks' computers and printers all worked! Sounds simple, but how come other hotels don't earn the same respect? Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Recent stay in May, 2013

reviews.text: This is a pricey but beautiful hotel in a location convenient to North Michigan Avenue shopping (and El trains or buses to anywhere), with city resources (a big pharmacy, movies, liquor store are only a block away if you want to save on mini-bar costs, see a film, or pick up a forgotten item!) But what struck me most was the really amazing warmth and hospitality of their staff -- every person from the phone operators, reception, bell desk, restaurant, and custodial staff seemed much nicer than in most hotels and FAR nicer than I've encountered before in Chicago. Extremely comfortable bed, very clean and quiet room, gorgeous view out over the Water Street park. Bike rental and riverwalk out the back door of the hotel. Good in-house restaurants, with superb convention services (the most sophisticated set-up for a PowerPoint talk that I've seen anywhere, with really top-notch staff to trouble-shoot any computer glitches). I was presenting at a meeting here, and was highly impressed with the whole place, from a comfort, convenience, and business standpoint. The internet is about $13/day if you are not a VIP (this is a problem in Chicago generally). The "Go!" shuttle can get you to Midway airport or O'Hare for a reasonable price, this hotel does not have an in-house shuttle.
reviews.title: Warmer hospitality than at most upscale hotels with lux rooms & views

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel and towers for a conference and loved the place. The rooms were spacious, there was a coffee maker and a refrigerator, and the view over the river was beautiful. The hotel is very conveniently located and the outdoor patios are on the river. All personnel were courteous and helpful and check-in and check-out was a breeze.would definitely stay again and have been recommending it to friends.
reviews.title: a beautiful setting

reviews.text: This is located right near the Navy Pier so it is in the center of action. It is efficient quiet, and clean but has little else to recommend it. There is nothing special about the place. I wouldn't choose to stay here unless I happened to get a great deal on the price. No ice machine, no free wireless, no convenient Starbucks or clone in the lobby.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient, but souless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have previously stayed at this hotel and enjoyed it. I stayed about four or five years ago for my birthday and was really impressed. I felt then that it was well managed and well maintained, which is difficult for a hotel of this size and capacity. This time around, I was also impressed overall (although not very impressed by the rooms, somewhat dated, although nothing major, and they are fine given that you dont spend the bulk of your time in Chicago in the room).
reviews.title: A mostly pleasant stay...

reviews.text: The hotel itself seems very well maintained and has a lot of amenities (business center, a few restaurants, bars, great location on the river, pool, parking (although a rip off at $48 when you can go next door, literally, for $26) and nice views. Overall, for the price in Chicago I would rate this hotel pretty well, and it should be noted that I am pretty picky when it comes to hotels!
reviews.title: Mattress change?

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel made it by far the nicest vacation my family and I have had in a long time and possibly ever! Every single employee was genuinely thrilled to work there and it showed with how they treated their guests. The price was reasonable for a hotel this nice in this location (downtown Chicago) but what made it stand far above the rest was the hotel staff in every department. I cannot say enough nice things about them all!
reviews.title: Best Hotel I have ever stayed at by far!!

reviews.text: Loved the room, loved the view but still can't understand considering the prices they charge, why they can't offer free internet in the rooms (12.95/day)!!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: This hotel is very well located . You are walking distance to the most attractions.
reviews.title: LOCATION LOCATION AND LOCATION !!!!

reviews.text: For this trip, I was looking for a hotel in a good location and this hotel has it....
reviews.title: Good pool and great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I trully recommend this hotel if you have the same interesting.
reviews.title: Great location...
Stayed one night on August 19th. We were...
reviews.text: Stayed one night on August 19th. We were upgraded to a higher floor room with a beautiful view of navy pier/ water. The room however needs some upgrades. The bathroom is old, old tub, moldy counter, old faucets and chipped/scuffed paint. The rooms are tiny. The only plus to the room was the Starbucks coffee with real creamer, no powdered crap, and the view. Valet parking was also a pain, they said to call ahead of time to get your car, but no one answered. So then we had to schlep our baggage/ two kids down a service elevator to the garage where they retrieved our car for us. For over $40 a night for parking you would at least expect some decent service.
Great and helpful staff. Clean rooms. Close to Navy Pier. Nice bar and resturant on site or a short walk to many other resturants.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.text: Pay $13 a day for internet access, $13 a day for fitness room access, extra charge to unlock the fridge that is already in the room, $6 for the bottled water in your room if you don't want to go back to the shop in the lobby to buy the $2 soda because there are no vending machines in the building. I had just spent 11 days on the road earlier in the month and had stayed at motels that cost half the price and threw in all the extras.
reviews.title: Tired of being nickeled and dimed.

reviews.text: Yes, the location is right downtown, but the rooms are a little tired, the carpeting is worn, and the cleaning leaves a little to be desired( there was an old used towel hanging in the bathroom at check in.) If you can get a room here for less than $120 go for it, otherwise I would look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great Visit

reviews.text: This was our first trip to Chicago as a family and the location of the Sheraton was prefect. Right down by the lake and it seemed close to everything we wanted to do. The lobby is expansive and even though the hotel has many rooms we didn't have to wait long for service or an elevator and the staff was always ready to help. Shula's Steakhouse was great and the hamburger joint was perfect for a quick bite. Try and get a room as high in the tower as possible because the views are spectacular, especially at night. Way to go guys, we'll be back
reviews.title: Big hotel, overall a good place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights whilst at a conference, and for that type of event it is ideal, as it's within easy walking distance of Navy Pier, boat trips on river, Michigen Avenue etc. But it's rather impersonal and I wouldn't choose to stay there for vacation or a weekend break.
reviews.title: Ideal situation, but hotel lookinga little "tired"

reviews.text: Beds extremely comfortable and our room on 30th floor was quiet. However, our room, the corridors and pool area all looked rather "tired" and are in need of a re-furb. Breakfast expensive for what it was.
reviews.title: Giant Boring Convention Hotel with great views of the city

reviews.text: Concierge recommended a five-minute walk to an Italian restaurant called Volare, which was excellent.
reviews.title: Awful experience from beginning to end

reviews.text: Typical hotel for large events. Just not my thing.
reviews.title: Good Facilities, but decor in the 80's

reviews.text: PROS: Expensive restaurants/cafes onsite. Clean quiet room. River views amazing.
reviews.title: Do not book this hotel using Hotwire

reviews.text: Great hotel, really great location, especially in the summer where it's centrally located between the Navy Pier, Loop, and Michigan Ave. No complaints, except the pool is not good for smaller children.
reviews.title: Great stay, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, our stay was very nice. We would like to highlight the work of the Concierge desk in helping us find restaurants, make reservations and get around town. They were fantastic.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, nice rooms, helpful concierge

reviews.text: One really big improvement to ask is to turn the air conditioning down a bit. While nice to have a chill to knock the heat off when you enter, the lobby was absolutely freezing. Our rooms were kept so cold that when we returned we started turning the a/c off altogether so that we did not get more sick as both my girlfriend and I both came down with headcolds in August at night. Not a hard thing to fix or a huge complaint, but something we noticed.
reviews.title: What great service!

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this starwood property and would do it again in a heartbeat. The front desk agents were very professional and attentative. The gentleman who checked me in was Alex. He was excellent and answered all the questions I had as I was there for a music festival and was traveling by foot. This hotel is in an excellent location and many Chicago attractions are within walking distance. The view from our sleeping room was breath taking! The Chicago River, Trump Tower, John Hancock and the Sears tower were all seen from one window!!! I want to go back already.
reviews.title: Good Weekend Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on a busy August weekend. All the staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was clean and fine with a nice view of the river and Lake Michigan. The location is good for walking to Navy Pier and the Mag Mile shopping and several good eating places. I found the directions for self-parking a bit confusing but we did OK and had no other problems. If staying a couple days I would recommend a bus pass of which there are several options...I think you can purchase them at several locations, one being a grocery store just across the street from this hotel. I did not like the extra charges for the pool and workout center.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, could use some updating the rooms and better housekeeping

reviews.text: This was a very clean hotel with comfortable beds. Room was quiet and I did not hear my neighbors. Valet Parking offered, self parking cheaper and attached to the hotel. One block from Michigan Avenue and close to shopping and restaurants. The Subway was a few blocks away, buses close by. Movie Theater nearby. I would stay again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights on a business trip and had no complaints. Check-in was effortless (thanks Alexandra!) and its convenient location made the trip tolerable. I’m not sure how much the room cost (probably not cheap), but if I had to choice on my next business trip to Chi-Town, this Sheraton would be right up there. Also, room service was pretty good – try the buffalo wings!
reviews.title: Great Location – Excellent Staff – A Fine Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent customer service, with very good responsiveness to frequent stay guest. Very good location near to all action--museums, recreation, restaurants, etc. Very professional and helpful staff. Club room breakfast and snacks were a nice bonus.
reviews.title: Sheraton Chicago stay

reviews.text: I had a fantastic stay at the Sheraton Chicago - the staff were welcoming immediately upon arrival and throughout the duration of my stay. The rooms were clean, very comfortable and well equipped. I was particularly pleased with the size, quality and cleanliness of the fitness & pool areas - which I am usually disappointed by in other hotels. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a stay in Chicago.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay at Sheraton Chicago Towers

reviews.text: On a last minute notice we decided to book a room at the Sheraton. We were very pleased by the friendly service experienced during our stay. What was very impressive was the consistency of the service from our initial check to the time for us to depart. We asked for a later checkout which was handled upon our arrival in a very pleasant and comforting manner.
reviews.title: Memorial Day Weekend

reviews.text: Room was nice and clean. Front desk staff very nice and friendly when checking in.Breakfast was the best and they are the nicest people. Free drink inthe evening is nice and bar tender was friendly. Suppose to have a good concierge but when I asked questions about local things to do she acted like I was not good enough to talk too. But the bellman was so helpful and friendly- told us great places to eat and do. Pool is so small that if more than 4-5 people in it you could not swim around.Asked for no maid services since I really hate to have any one in my room when I am not there but we left the hotel but then I forgot to get something so I went back to the room and our room door was a jar called the front desk and the just said ok and since nothing was missing it was probably just a mistake on my part that I just did not close the door. No internet in room have to go down into lobby to use internet or pay more for it. Parking is very high. I wish I had written down all the helpful and friendly staff so I could give you kudos for a job well done and jeers for the people that need to be out of any personal service career.
reviews.title: Great breakfast but not much more

reviews.text: Recently had an opportunity to stay at the Sheraton due to a conference. Loved the great service, friendly staff and wonderful conference venue. The room was spacious and I had a wonderful view of the water! Close in proximity to all the local must do things in Chicago! Kudos to the Sheraton and Staff!
reviews.title: Great Venue!

reviews.text: I have taken my granddaughters to the Sheraton Hotel and Towers for the past 5 years. We
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: are extremely pleased with our accommodations and the way we are made to feel special year after year. The staff is friendly, courteous and helpful. The hotel is always clean, easy to access all areas and is just awesome!
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.text: We were treated with such welcome when we arrived and were taken care of exceptionally well our entire stay. The staff was friendly and very helpful! The General Manager deserves major kudos for managing such a large staff and one of the largest hotels in the city, and it you would think it was a tiny hotel for the kindness and organization. We will definitely be staying there again and appreciate all of the hard work from everyone who helped may our visit far beyond anyting we expected! :)
reviews.title: A great stay.

reviews.text: Right by the river, easy walk to Navy pier and the mile, when we arrived we were immediately upgraded to a larger room because we had young children, no extra charge, room cleaning and service was really great. Strongly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great stay
The best trip ever!
reviews.text: No complaints at all about this hotel...it was great because I shared it with four other friends, so less expensive..:))

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the basic amenities that you would expect -- but really turned off by the little attempts to extort extra money from guests. In this day and age I expect wireless internet as a basic service. Most 2 star hotels offer free wireless. So it is a little upsetting to have to pay $12.00 a night just to get a hardwire internet connection. Both I and my wife had our laptops and only 1 of us could use at a time. What is the deal with expensive hotels -- why do they think its ok to charge extra for sub-par internet access? $50.00 per night parking was also very high -- even for Chicago. Would not stay here again until they updated their internet and made it a free service.
reviews.title: Nice hotel -- but cash grabs spoil experience

reviews.text: Just wanted to say that our stay (family~ children ages 8 & 9) was FABULOUS this summer!! The staff was very helpful and courteous~not only with hotel issues but as we explored Chicago! All of our future visits to Chicago will involve staying at the Sheraton.
reviews.title: The Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers Is Wonderful

reviews.text: My husband, young daughter and I just got back from 3 nights at the Sheraton Towers. We were very happy with the hotel's location. It's a short walk to Navy Pier and the Mag Mile and there are many grocery stores and parks nearby. The pool was very nice as well.
reviews.title: Rather Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location for a trip to Chicago. We were in walking distance from the Magnificent Mile, Grant Park, Millenium Park etc. The concierge for this property was very helpful on multiple occasions regarding places to eat and walking distances to certain attractions in the area. The service award goes to the bellmen of this property. Tons of personality! I work in the hotel business in New Orleans(at a Starwood property) and recognize great service when I see it and these gentlemen have it. The only thing I would change would be to pay a little more attention to detail in the restroom inside the room. Keep up the good work!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!!!

reviews.text: We had a great experience @ Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers. Our check in was smooth, even though I had a lot of questions and was asking for changes to be made last minute. The lady who checked us in was very helpful and friendly. We were offered access to the Tower Club Lounge which was opening for hors· d'oeuvres as we arrived. The attendant (Rene) was very friendly and was a big hit with our girls. The concierge helped us navigate to a great restraunt for a date night as well as helping us get to Oak Street Beach for the afternoon and find parking.
reviews.title: Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THe location is great, you are in walking distance to the navy pier and miricle mile, and other areas along the river. it was a great stay, the rooms are clean and everyone is nice and willing to help get you a cab if need be. i would def. recommend to a friend, rooms are a bit small and nothing too exciting or extraordinary but clean clean clean.
reviews.title: Great location right downtown

reviews.text: The lobby and common areas are very nice and the service is good, but the rooms are little dated. Bathrooms are very small for a hotel of this caliber. The vanity is small and the bath is just a regular shower/bathtub combination. Ceiling in the bathroom is very low. I didn't like having plastic cups considering the price of the hotel. On the plus side the beds were comfortable and it was quiet.It is located on the Chicago River and offers and the riverside rooms offer nice views. It is located near shopping and the Navy Pier.
reviews.title: Rooms a little dated!

reviews.text: Stayed here for five nights, combined business and pleasure. Hotel is very well positioned for access to Navy Pier, the river (great restaurants), Mag Mile, Millenium Park, Art Institute. The concierge staff was particularly helpful with all travel logistices, restaurant tips. We particularly appreciated the 'go to the head of the seating line' for Yolk, an area breakfast/lunch spot that seemingly always has a waiting list. What a great perk!
reviews.title: Conveniently located, great service
Sheraton Hotel and Towers in Chicago did not disappoint!
reviews.text: This was our first trip to the City of Chicago and to the Sheraton Hotel and Towers. The location was perfect and our accommodations overlooked the river as it meandered below the flower clad streets and bridges providing a landscape of varied architectural styled buildings and skyscrapers-beautiful views- day and night! From check-in to check-out, our stay was comfortable and easy. Well appointed rooms and wonderful beds, attentive staff, and concierge staff that acted on every request made in a timely fashion.

very nice reception, nice hotel, big space, excellent service, they provided a coffe machine with all...a little bit messy the room service, we left a used cup and they didn´t clean it...and there was a used towels when we arrived....
reviews.title: Nice but a little old

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our friend stayed in other room that leaked with the rain trough the windows....
reviews.title: Great Location with Beautiful Views

reviews.text: Location: very good
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay

reviews.text: We got lucky and had a bit of an upgrade for a room. They gave us a corner room so we had a little sofa and chair sitting area.
reviews.title: Stayed Twice and Will Return Again - A pleasant surprise

reviews.text: Stayed here during Spring Break in March with my kids (9 &11). Very centrally located to everything (Millenium Park, Navy Pier, movie theater, Michigan Ave). Beds are very comfortable. Love a hotel that has 2 Queen beds instead of Doubles, although it makes the room a little tight. Price was perfect - $99/night and the most helpful front desk folks gave us an upgrade to a river/lake view after asking if I was Starwood member (which I forgot I was). Only complaint was the very lengthy line at check-in, probably 20-30 people in front of me. I must have hit a bad time because it wasn't like that any other time during our stay.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in Chicago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superior service, high-quality amenities, and a great location. It was an awesome night's stay and we received much needed rest due to the comfort of our room. I would stay at this property again and feel good knowing that I would receive great treatment the next time and in the future.
reviews.title: Vania V.

reviews.text: It was a beautiful view from the 28th floor. The suite was great too. We were close enough to walk around and do some shopping. The staff was very friendly and the room was very clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Beautiful room with a beautiful view.

reviews.text: I booked a room ay the Sheraton Towers through Priceline's "Name your own price" tool at a very competitive price.
reviews.title: Wonderful view of the Lake and Navy Pier

reviews.text: I got there from Union Station by taking Chicago Transit's Red Line and a bus, to discover a wonderful room with a great view of Navy Pier and the surrounding towers.
reviews.title: 4th Stay this year -

reviews.text: Stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and towers for 1 week over New Years 2010/11. Got a hotwire deal that was excellent value. The location was perfect for shopping and sight seeing. The leasure facilities were good and overlooked the river which was nice looking at the snow and ice outside! At busy periods there wasn't much pleasure but early morning was good. The hotel was very clean and well maintained and was big and airy. The beds were super comfortable and the pillows were divine! I cannot imagine that every room did not have a great view. Would stay again and would recommend.
reviews.title: Great Location, sound hotel

reviews.text: I had never been to Chicago and wanted a weekend girls getaway. This was the perfect choice! The staff was super friendly - from the door men, to the waitress at the Chicago burger place...we were treated like family.I really enjoyed the outside deck off the pool and the dining outside right off the river. The location was about 2-3 blocks to Michigan Ave and Navy Pier. Everything you need is right there a block away...Wallgreens and your local liquor store(hee hee). Even when we had to take a cab to the local bars...we never spent more than 6 bucks. NO walking in high heals...Thanks Sheraton- it was a blast. I'll be back. PS...if you have AAA the discount is great!
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff...Wonderful Location...Just Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big fancy conference type hotel, maybe about 2 blocks from michigan ave -easily walkable to shopping. We stayed in the higher floors, the room was very clean and modern for the most part.no mini fridge but ice machine nearby. The room provided a bottle of water but I didn't touch it since i would imagine they they would charge you $5 for it? Didn't have time for swimming but the indoor lap pool looked decent although the water looked a little merky..there is a pool towel boy/check in desk before you enter so you would think he would have time to check the chemicals once in awhile. Nice outdoor deck looking over the river. TIP** free internet at the internet cafe down in the basement area. A block across from the hotel is a domicks grocery,walgreens,amc theater/game place, Its about a 25 minute walk to the navy pier and millinium park. I would suggest taking a cab to millinium park-Its walkable but had to go through a long under pass and it smelled like urine and it was creepy.
reviews.title: Can't complain for the hotwire price of $114

reviews.text: We stayed 1 night on the 29th floor. Used Starpoints. This was our 3rd stay at this hotel. It's not bad, but we had some service issues this time around -- waited a LONG time for a cell phone charger to be retrieved and brought to the concierge desk. Communication among staff in different departments seemed to be the culprit.
reviews.title: Good location, decent condition, questionable value and service

reviews.text: The pool is nice. Fitness center looks very nice as well, although we did not use it. Newer equipment.
reviews.title: Good location, rude front desk people, overall pretty average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had such a great experience at the Sheraton for our one year wedding anniversary!
reviews.title: Stay-cation at The Sheraton

reviews.text: We actually live in Chicago and for our one year we decided to do a “stay-cation”. A little getaway, that wasn’t that far away. There are many different hotel options in Chicago, but we stayed at a Sheraton property for our honeymoon, so we thought the Sheraton in Chicago was fitting for this occasion. Upon arrival, we were instantly thrilled about our choice. The entrance of the Sheraton is very stunning and grand! It may have been because there was a physician conference in town, but the energy was very lively. People were all over, the staff was happy and eager to help. The first person we came in contact with was Zack Brewer at the reception desk. He took our information, made pleasant conversation and let us know the exciting news that we were upgraded to an Executive suite for our anniversary. YAY! He was very helpful with directions around the facility and definitely lived up to, “service with a smile”.
reviews.title: Live, breathe Chicago here!

reviews.text: We got our key and headed to our room. As we walked down the long hall we were happy to find a corner unit with great views. YAY!
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hung out in our suite, taking full advantage of the large selection of television stations the room had to offer while we got ready for our dinner reservations. When we were ready to leave, the doormen were very professional in helping us get a cab, opening the door and shutting it behind us. When we arrived back in our room, we had surprises waiting for us. Who doesn’t love surprises? We had a pretzel and mustard platter waiting for us with a note from The Sheraton expressing their gratitude for us coming to the Sheraton and my friend also had chocolate covered strawberries sent with a note and sparkling water. After we got settled, we had another delivery of champagne that my friend requested be sent with the strawberries. It’s probably good they waited for us to get back for the champagne. Warm champagne just isn’t the same. Eventually we retired to the extremely comfy bed for a little TV and a good night’s sleep.
reviews.title: The perfect location in Chicago!

reviews.text: It was an enjoyable and memorable stay. We’ve also had a chance to connect with General Manager, Rick Ueno. He is very friendly and is doing a great job with this property. I know in Chicago there are many hotels to choose from, but I would definitely suggest The Sheraton to a friend.
reviews.title: Wonderfutl!

reviews.text: I don't normally take the time to write a review, but after reading some of the things people had to say about this hotel I wanted to give another opinion. THIS HOTEL IS EXCELLENT!!! If you don't expect to pay a lot for parking or for a clean room in a good location, then don't go to Chicago! It's very hard to find a good, clean, cheap room in a safe area, so you should expect to pay more before you even make your reservations. The front desk was very friendly. The concierge was extremly helpful (they even gave us coupons to use). The rooms were normal double bed size rooms, but they were clean; and that is my biggest concern when traveling. The location is GREAT!! The hotel is just a short walk to State St or Michigan Ave to catch buses & is in walking distance to Navy Pier. (We walked there but took the trolley back as we were tired by 10:00 at night). We did eat breakfast one day at the cafe downstairs, and that was way overpriced & not very good (so I was glad we received $10 in gift cards to use there for "going green" in the hotel room). Try the Corner Bakery instead for bagels, muffins, coffee, & breakfast sandwiches (it is literally called the "Corner Bakery.) The only bad thing I can say about the hotel is that we heard music from outside at night, even on the 26th floor; but we were so tired both nights that the a/c drowned out the noise & we fell asleep quickly anyways.
reviews.title: Family Getaway w/3 kids

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in early July, at an extremely busy event. Although the hotel was fairly well prepared for the thousands of people attending, there was not a lot of space in the common areas. Check in was nice and easy, although there was a pretty broad interpretation of "river or lake view" in our case. We could see a sliver the lake if we stood with our head against the window!
reviews.title: Could have been better, could have been worse

reviews.text: The room was nice, clean and a decent size, however I am very tired of hotels of this calibre cheaping out on double beds. For that amount of money, I think I deserve to sprawl out in a queen size bed, and I would gladly give up a couple of feet of worn carpet to do so! The cleaning staff were clearly overworked (the hotel was sold out and the guests were focused on a high-level competition, so keeping their things tidy was not high on the list). I commented on this to the cleaning staff on our floor, and they had a very good attitude about it. They were very friendly.
reviews.title: Thank you for making our trip the best!

reviews.text: The only down-side to this hotel is the cost of the food. Many will argue that it is standard for hotels to charge almost $20 for 2 eggs, but to me, that is just wrong. They have a high-end steakhouse in the lobby - that does not smell very appetizing, by the way - where you can get a steak for close to $40. Another $9 or $10 if you want a potato or a vegetable with it. We chose to have dinner elsewhere.
reviews.title: Best Location in Chicago!

reviews.text: For breakfast, they had the usual buffet that cost $20-25. To encourage you to choose this option, they made the menu ridiculously overpriced. Or you could wait in a 20 minute line in the little internet cafe next door. Most times, when the hotel is not sold out, this would be a good option. I enjoyed a 5-minute walk to Starbucks across from the beautiful Tribune Tower on most days.
reviews.title: Great rooms, great location

reviews.text: Just spent two nights at the Chicago Sheraton and despite being a large chain hotel this place was so friendly and comfortable to stay at. Great location for any sights downtown or on the lake. Superb beds and heavenly pillow. Just one small complaint - get rid of the minibar and the touch sensitive tray that tempts the unwitting or careless traveler and results in those outrageous charges.
reviews.title: Graet stay at the Chicago Sheraton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are lots of hotels in downtown Chicago, but I would say this Sheraton at this location is the "best of all worlds". The location is amazing...close to the 'Lake' and Navy Pier, close to the Magnificent Mile, close to Rush Street the center of great restuarants and bars! If you top that off with staff that go 'above and beyond' (Especially Connie), you have an experience to take home and talk about :) The people there make you feel like making your stay special is foremost on their minds. Thanks to this Sheraton and it's employees for making our trip special!
reviews.title: Great from all angles

reviews.text: Our 22 room night stay should have been incredible considering we were spending well over $7000 with the property (2 rooms for 11 nights), however it was anything but. It began going down hill when we first checked in (at 2:45) and were told our room was not ready. No problem, check in isn't until 3:00, so we understood the delay. However, nearly 2 hours later, exhausted from our 12 hour travel day, our room still was not ready. From here we found the staff to be unfriendly and almost stuck up. The front desk proved to be incompetent on several occasions and our room was not always made up. The conceirge was very helpful and kind however. I was not impressed by the rooms either. For nearly $300 a night I was certainly underwhelmed. I have stayed at many hotels in Chicago, and have never paid as much per night as the Sheraton, but have always had a better experience! I will continue to stay at the Palmer House, Chicago Hilton or the Dana from now on. Those are hotels with SERVICE!
reviews.title: Appalling Service

reviews.text: I think Sheraton lives out of its name in most of its establishments. I know it needs to respond to a demand for classic and standard therefore it lacks a personal touch. Obviously the service was good and the deluxe room rather standard. In a city like Chicago I personally next time will opt for something more special, given the wide choice.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: I'm a big fan of SPG hotels, but this Sheraton is operating using its own rules.
reviews.title: Sheraton Fan, But Not This One!

description: The Sheraton Chicago Hotel & Towers is within walking distance of Navy Pier, Millennium Park, Hancock Tower, and Michigan Avenue. We have 37 meeting rooms, including a luxurious 40,000 sq ft ballroom.
